page.title: 03COMMON LAND USE STROUD
page.content: The National Trust own the Common. Every summer 400 beasts are allowed on Minchinhampton and 240 on adjoining Rodborough Common.Only Commoners can graze beasts but only l7 out of 256 take up their rights.It costs Â£4 for a cow or horse and Â£2 for a goat.The Vicar of Amberley grazes some goats.On Minchinhampton no bulls are allowed. Beasts used to be branded but one year a bucket of pitch was kicked over and badly burned a brander.Now they use plastic tags with the colour changing every year.People use the Common for things like flying kites and model aeroplanes, as well as playing football and golf.Golf has been played since l880 despite cows walking across the greens.Animals seem to like Minchinhampton Common best but there are more wild flowers on Rodborough as well as a caravan site.
